IpAllowListParams.description: Model for login IP allow list parameters

PublicNetworkCidrBlock.description: Model for Public Network CIDR Block

IpAllowListParams.description: Model for login IP allow list parameters

cidr.description: List of CIDRs to Allow List for login access. You can include from 1 to 10 CIDRs

description.description: Description of CIDR (IP addresses) allow list

name.description: Unique name for CIDR (IP addresses) allow list

LoginIpAllowListData.description: Model for login IP allow list data

cidr.description: List of CIDR blocks (IP addresses) from which access is allowed when Login IP Allow List is enabled.

lastModifiedTs.description: Timestamp for last modification of CIDR block list

name.description: Name of the list of CIDR blocks that are in allow list for access

cidr.description: Valid CIDR. CIDR must be of the form [0-255].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255]/[1-32], must not have non-zero bits right of the netmask, and must not overlap any of the RFC 1918 defined private networks.

info.description: Mange a list of trusted IP addresses with respect to alerts and a list of trusted login IP addresses.
info.title: Prisma Cloud IP Allow List API Overview

tags.description: The IP Allow List APIs are listed below.
tags.name: IP Allow List

get.description: Returns an array of public networks.

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/allow_list/network"

headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/allow_list/network \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/allow_list/network"

headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("POST", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/allow_list/network \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

get.description: Retrieve a specific network using the network ID.

response = requests.request("PUT", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request PUT \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/allow_list/network/%7BnetworkUuid%7D \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

get.description: Returns a list of data objects that contain the CIDRs in the allow list to access the Prisma Cloud tenant.

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login"

headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

post.description: Adds a named list of CIDRs (IP addresses) that are in the allow list to access Prisma Cloud. You can add up to 10 CIDRs per named list, and there can be up to 50 named lists.

requestBody.description: Model for login IP allow list parameters

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login"

payload = "{\"cidr\":[\"string\"],\"description\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\"}"
headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("POST", url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"cidr":["string"],"description":"string","name":"string"}'

get.description: Returns a data object that contains a list of CIDRs that are in allow list for login access, for the specified login IP allow list ID.

x-codeSamples.source:

headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login/%7Bid%7D \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

put.description: Updates a named list of CIDRs (IP addresses) that are in the allow list for login access.

requestBody.description: Model for login IP allow list parameters

delete.description: Deletes a named list of CIDRs that are in the allow list for login access. If only one allow list entry exists, you will not be able to delete it while the login IP allow list is enabled.

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login/%7Bid%7D"

headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("DELETE", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request DELETE \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login/%7Bid%7D \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

get.description: Indicates whether or not the login IP allow list is enabled.
get.summary: Get Login IP Allow List Status

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login/status"

headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login/status \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

patch.description: Enable or disable the login IP allow list.
patch.summary: Update Login IP Allow List Status

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login/status"

payload = "{\"property1\":{},\"property2\":{}}"
headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'x-redlock-auth': "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
    }

response = requests.request("PATCH", url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request PATCH \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/ip_allow_list_login/status \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"property1":{},"property2":{}}'

get.description: Returns whether or not the login IP allow list feature is available.
get.summary: Get Login IP Allow List Availability
